content: 95% of this article is a an anecdote about being sick with the final 5% being a jumble fuck of progressive terminology jammed into an intelligible paragraph. Nowhere in this article does the author actually discuss the male gaze or what she learned from it as the click bait title asserts. The most frustrating part of this article is that the personal anecdote is actually pretty compelling. Unfortunately it is cheapened by being clumsily interpreted through the lens of the patriarchal male gaze. An effort that not only fails to correctly use the term, but fails to communicate how it is very relevant to her experience at all.
